item.title: Slow-motion humiliation for Starmer as he loses control of Commons
item.description: The BBC's political editor Chris Mason and chief political correspondent Henry Zeffman on the welfare bill.

item.title: Prosecutors consider further charges against Lucy Letby
item.description: The Crown Prosecution Service is considering a "full file" of evidence submitted by Cheshire Police.

item.title: Heathrow shutdown caused by problem found seven years ago
item.description: An investigation has been launched by the energy regulator into National Grid after finding issues at a substation were not fixed.

item.title: Bob Vylan dropped from music festivals after Glastonbury controversy
item.description: The band made headlines with controversial comments on stage at Glastonbury about the IDF.

item.title: Scorching European heatwave turns deadly in Spain and France
item.description: Two people were found dead by firefighters tackling a blaze in Spain's Catalonia region.

item.title: Trump says Israel has agreed to conditions for 60-day Gaza ceasefire
item.description: A Hamas official told the BBC the group is "ready and serious" to reach an agreement if it ends the war.

item.title: Diddy jury are deadlocked on racketeering charge - but what is it?
item.description: The jury in the rapper's federal trial in New York is still deliberating over one remaining charge.

item.title: Banknotes are getting a makeover - and the Bank of England wants your help
item.description: The first facelift in more than 50 years signals the possible end of historical figures on notes.

item.title: Dalai Lama confirms he will have a successor after his death
item.description: The exiled leader of Tibetan Buddhism issues a landmark announcement as he turns 90, ending years of uncertainty.

item.title: Inquiry finds British committed genocide on Indigenous Australians
item.description: It is the country's first formal "truth-telling" inquiry that ran for four years from 2021.

item.title: Don't call him Oliver - the British qualifier aiming to stun Alcaraz
item.description: From off-the-radar teenager to US college star - British qualifier Oliver Tarvet is aiming to stun Carlos Alcaraz.

item.title: 'They took shrapnel from my heart' – the magnets saving lives in Ukraine
item.description: A magnetic extractor is changing the face of front-line medicine in Ukraine.

item.title: Who are the welfare bill rebels? Find out how your MP voted
item.description: Check whether your MP voted for or against the Universal Credit and Personal Independence Payment Bill

item.title: Women's Euro 2025: Groups, fixture dates and who are favourites?
item.description: BBC Sport provides the lowdown on all the key details for the 2025 Women's European Championship.

item.title: After one of the driest springs on record, will there be a drought where you live?
item.description: We take a look at river, reservoir and groundwater levels after a particularly dry few months.

item.title: TSB could disappear from high street after £2.65bn sale to Santander
item.description: The bank is set to be integrated into Santander UK which has said there could be job cuts.

item.title: Paramount to pay Trump $16m to settle 60 Minutes lawsuit
item.description: The media company noted the settlement does not include a statement of apology or regret.

item.title: Man appears in court charged with murder of pregnant mother
item.description: Zak Hughes, 28, from Ardglen Place in north Belfast, is also charged with child destruction.

item.title: Chief exec of miscarriage of justice body quits after criticism
item.description: The CCRC has come under intense criticism since Andrew Malkinson's wrongful conviction was overturned.

item.title: At least 180 aircrew pursuing Ministry of Defence after cancer diagnoses
item.description: Zach Stubbings, who died in January, is one of at least six who have received a settlement from MoD.

item.title: Man, 92, to be investigated over more cold cases after murder conviction
item.description: Ryland Headley, who has been convicted of a decades-old murder, is to be investigated over unsolved offences.

item.title: BBC News app
item.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

item.title: Welfare Bill Passes, But At What Cost?
item.description: Last minute concessions mean government avoids possible defeat.

item.title: Has the Supreme Court made Trump more powerful than ever?
item.description: And will Congress pass his big beautiful bill before July 4th?

item.title: Don't call him Oliver - the British qualifier aiming to stun Alcaraz
item.description: From 'off-the-radar' teenager to US college star - meet the British qualifier seeking to shock defending champion Carlos Alcaraz at Wimbledon.

item.title: Leverkusen sign Quansah from Liverpool for £35m
item.description: Bayer Leverkusen sign defender Jarell Quansah from Liverpool in a £35m deal.
